intro: Amphymenium rohrii, commonly known as the Rohri's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a latex that is milky and can be irritating to the skin. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
